document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Encolapta Meyrick, 1913 (Lepidoptera: Gelechiidae: Chelariini) from China, with descriptions of six new species

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 32 ) with wingspan 17.0−23.0 mm. This species is superficially similar to
E . aganactes ( Meyrick, 1935 )
in the forewing ground color much darker in distal 1/4.
Encolapta sheni
can be separated by having an apex-rounded uncus and an apex-rounded aedeagus in the male genitalia ( Fig. 46 ). In
E . aganactes
, the uncus is concave medially at apex and the aedeagus is pointed apically in the male genitalia ( Clarke 1969(6) : Pl. 217, Figs 1 c, 1d). The female genitalia of
E . sheni
can be separated from those of the other known
Encolapta
species by the rhombic ostium bursae and the eighth tergite with posterior margin strongly protruding for 3/4 the length of the eighth segment ( Fig. 57 ).
Distribution. China ( Anhui , Chongqing , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Henan , Hubei , Shaanxi , Yunnan , Zhejiang ).
